summary: The document is a secret memorandum from Mr. Ramon R. Hart to the Chief of the Support Branch, dated 18 July 1963, detailing the completion of the initial phase of audio surveillance on Manuel F. ARTIME Buesa at a SAS safehouse in Bethesda. It outlines the strategy for enhanced surveillance upon ARTIME's return to Washington, D.C., which includes the installation of microphones, a telephone tap, and tape recorders to monitor conversations between ARTIME and his Cuban associate, Rafael Aurelio QUINTERO Ibarbia. The plan also involves using a cover story for the equipment installation, anticipating superior audio surveillance outcomes in this next phase.
key_findings: Completion of the first phase of audio surveillance on Manuel F. ARTIME Buesa.
Preparation for advanced surveillance upon ARTIME's return, including the setup of microphones, a telephone tap, and tape recorders.
Implementation of a cover story to discreetly install surveillance equipment.
Anticipation of significantly improved audio surveillance results in the upcoming phase.
